channel.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
channel.description:
when i opened the apparmor (arm) in whonix-gateway 9.6 with tester repository the following message appeared with brown color:-
[code]Events (TOR/ARM NOTICE - ERR): 22:21:11 [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address [scrub-bed][/code]

item.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
This subject popped up into my profile as one of the most popular searched topic related to my posts, well if some how ppl still trying to figure out errors showing up there its well documented here:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Controller#Nyx_FAQ

Read full topic

item.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
well u r true , the one i reported is the correct one. not in the FAQ

[WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address

because SOCKS im very sure i have read it and its obvious word.

sorry if i didnt make it clear.

Read full topic
item.source: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address

item.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I don’t think those are related.

So we have your report.

And we have the one from the arm faq.

Can you you real copy and paste please? Because if you mistype, we might be chasing a ghost here. Or be sure you typed the right one?

In your case you really read “Rejecting SOCKS request”, not “Rejecting request for”?

Read full topic
item.source: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address

item.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
This is caused by whonixcheck (by function check_tor_socks_port_reachability). It checks if a Tor SocksPort is reachable by trying to fetch it using curl. It will not report anything if it worked, but would complain if it failed. [WARN] Rejecting request for anonymous connection to private address [scrubbed]

this quote was one of the passages inside the link that u gave me:-

Whonix – 12 Dec 19

Control and Monitor Tor

Using a Tor Controller with Whonix ™. onioncircuits. Nyx. Vidalia. View or Change your Tor circuits. Monitor Tor and inspect logs.

i meant by this:-

effecting on tor ports

that the

[WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
is might be a result from this one:-

File /var/run/control-port-filter-python/pid does not exist
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1130.0.html

so the passage quote and my problem i thought they r related , so im just asking if they r.

Read full topic
item.source: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address

item.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Are you sure you copied the message and didn’t mistype?

“effecting on tor ports” no idea what you mean by that. As long as everything is working, arm isn’t a tool purposed to find out any serious issues. So nothing it shows is any big sign of alarm.

Read full topic
item.source: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address

item.title: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
i think im somewhere here:-

This is caused by whonixcheck (by function check_tor_socks_port_reachability). It checks if a Tor SocksPort is reachable by trying to fetch it using curl. It will not report anything if it worked, but would complain if it failed. [WARN] Rejecting request for anonymous connection to private address [scrubbed]

because this problem till now, it persistent:-

https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1130.0.html

so it might be effecting on tor ports ?

Read full topic
item.source: [WARN] Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address

item.description:
